ChunkText: the delay in applying for an ssn is often an important reason as to why students cannot get paid earlier in their first semester. students with existing ssns may not experience such a drastic delay in their first paycheck. the isss team will help you with the ssn application process.
ContextBefore: you can only apply for an ssn after the following: you are physically in the US in f-1 immigration status your sevis immigration record has been activated by isss please note, you cannot begin the process of getting on payroll with your department until you have applied for a social security number.
ContextAfter: of special note to students changing their immigration status: please note that you cannot hold a ga position unless you are in an immigration status that allows you to work and be paid in the us. please contact isss with questions about whether or not your status allows you to work.
